--- title: 'Technology Adoption' subtitle: 'Welcome to #TidyTuesday 2022 day 29' date: '2022-07-19' image: 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Fgazzelloni/TidyTuesday/main/data/2022/w29_technology/w29_technology.png' image-alt: '' description: 'Networks' output: html_document execute: eval: false --- ## Cross-country Historical Adoption of Technology (CHAT) Data contains information on the adoption of over 100 technologies in more than 150 countries since 1800. Described is technology usage primarily based on per capita measures and divide technologies into the two broad categories of production and consumption. ::: {.cell paged.print='false'} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(knitr) knitr::opts_chunk$set(cache = TRUE, warning = FALSE, message = FALSE, comment = "", echo = TRUE, dpi = 300, cache.lazy = FALSE, tidy = "styler", fig.width = 8, fig.height = 5) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # technology <- readr::read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2022/2022-07-19/technology.csv') ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # saveRDS(technology,"technology.rds") technology <- readRDS("technology.rds") technology_df<-technology%>%select(-variable,-label) technology_df %>% count(group) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(ggtext) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} technology_df %>% filter(group%in%c("Consumption","Production")) %>% filter(iso3c=="ITA") %>% group_by(iso3c,year,group) %>% summarize(Average=round(mean(value)), Median=round(median(value)),.groups="drop")%>% ungroup() %>% pivot_longer(cols = c("Average","Median"),names_to="metric",values_to="values_metrics") %>% filter(values_metrics>0) %>% ggplot(aes(x=factor(year), y= values_metrics)) + geom_line(size=0.2,color="gray")+ geom_line(aes(group=factor(group), color=factor(group)), size=0.8)+ geom_point(aes(color=factor(group)),shape=21,stroke=0.6,size=2)+ scale_y_log10(labels=scales::comma_format())+ scale_x_discrete(breaks=seq(1839,2020,10))+ ggthemes::scale_color_fivethirtyeight() + ggthemes::theme_fivethirtyeight() + labs(title="Cross-country Historical Adoption of Technology (CHAT)", subtitle="Production vs Consuption

Data contains information on the adoption of over 100 technologies in more than 150 countries since 1800.
Described is technology usage primarily based on per capita measures and divide technologies into the two broad categories
of production and consumption. Evidences of average and median values differences explain distribution skewness and outliers.
The median is less affected by outliers and skewed data than the mean, and is usually the preferred measure of central tendency
when the distribution is not symmetrical.
Values are obtained grouping data by country, year and between production and consuption.
